answers.answer: A diabetic should ALWAYS see a doctor when there are any skin changes of the lower extremities.

question: My husband is 50 years old, has diabetes, non insulin dependent for a few years controlled by metformin 850 mg once a day, also high blood pressure conrolled by Diovan160 mg, Concor 5 mg and Lercandipin 10 mg. Also has Familiar Mediterranian fever conrolled by Colchicin 2 mg a day. He has also flat foot and overweight. 2 days ago he was walking much more than he is used to, and on both of his legs appeared a n aprox 10 cm diameter red spot above the inner ankles and also symmetrically, upper on his calf close to his knees also on the inside  1 and 1 much smallar, aprox 1 inch diameter red spots. No pain, no fever. What can it be?
title: Red spots on both calfs of a diab hypertension overweight man after physical strain
